Description: Nearly complete pottery mortarium, long slim collar rim, flat base. Clay buff to light orange-brown, fairly hard, some vegetable inclusions (marl clay?). Graffito dedication to Apollo on inside wall below lip: vac τωπολλ[...]ι vac retrograde. V-shape incised on inside wall opposite inscription.
Curator's comments: Possibly a locally-made copy of a Cypriot mortarium
Bibliographic references: Petrie 1886 / Naukratis. Part I., 1884-85 (p. 61, pl. XXXII, no. 77; pl. IV.2)
Bernand 1970 / Le Delta égyptien d'après les textes grecs, i: les confins libyques (p. 646, no. 38)
Villing 2006 / 'Drab Bowls' for Apollo: The Mortaria of Naukratis and Exchange in the Archaic Eastern Mediterranean (p. 31 fig. 1, no. 1)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (IA.38)
